meanings.sent1: The gosling followed its mother around the pond.
meanings.sent2: The farmer watched the gosling waddle after its siblings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gosling tried to swim in a bucket of water.
meanings.sent4: The fluffy gosling stood out among the adult geese like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The tiny gosling chirped loudly, demanding attention from the others.

meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or naive.
meanings.sent1: The new intern was a gosling in the corporate world.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a gosling in a room full of seasoned professionals.
meanings.sent3: The gosling of the group was easily fooled by the prank.
meanings.sent4: He was a gosling in the world of politics, unaware of the games played.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur was a gosling in the competitive market, learning as he went along.
